com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation

Interface Operation<Resource>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed, RunnableEntity
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ComputingOperation, NetworkOperation, RemoteOperation<Resource>, StorageOperation, SynchronizableOperation<Resource>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputingOperationDefault, LongOperationImpl, NetworkOperationDefault, OperationImpl, StorageOperationDefault, TimerOperation

    public interface Operation<Resource>
extends Entity, RunnableEntity
    An operation is RunnableEntity that needs a certain amount of running time in order to be completed.
    The needed running time directly depends on the allocated resource for the operation.

    As any other RunnableEntity you need to listen to the CoreNotificationCodes.RUNNABLE_STATE_CHANGED notification to know when the operation stops / is completed.

    See RunnableEntity for more information on runnable entities.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.RunnableEntity

        RunnableEntity.RunnableState

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Operation<Resource> clone()
      Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.
      Resource getAllocatedResource()
      Returns the current allocated resources for this operation or null if no resource is allocated for this operation.
      Job getParent()
      Returns parent job which also owns this operation.
      long getRemainingDelay()
      Returns the delay remaining until the end of this operation using the current allocated resources.
      long getTotalRunningTime()
      Returns the total accumulated simulation time when this operation was running.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        Operation<Resource> clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier
        Specified by:
        clone in interface RunnableEntity

      • getRemainingDelay

        long getRemainingDelay()
        Returns the delay remaining until the end of this operation using the current allocated resources.

        If the operation is running, the returned value takes into account the progress made during current activation.

        Returns:
        the delay remaining until the end of this operation using the current allocated resources
